intro: Taphrospermum himalaicum, commonly known as the Himalayan taphrospermum, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Capparaceae and is characterized by its small, green leaves and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows at high altitudes, often in rocky or alpine environments. It has a compact growth habit and is adapted to cold, harsh climates. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native habitat.
